> Tucson looks back to Vestige, as he slowly backs himself onto =
the other end of the catapult. He quickly turns back to the insects and pos=
itions himself to prepare for flight. He wastes no time in giving the signa=
l to implement his attempt to go airbourne.
>
> " NOW!"

Vestige looked con=
fused for the moment as it was *he* that needed to
unite with the figure on=
 the bed. But it was only a passing confusion
as he shrugged slightly, step=
ped off the metal and let Tuscon on. With
a blast of firepower he held off =
the approaching insectoids as he
cartwheeled to one side landing in a crouc=
hed position, his weapon hot
and smoking as it continued to lay down the ne=
eded cover fire. A quick
glance at it showed him that it was begining to ru=
n low, this battle
would need to end soon, or else . . .

As Tuscon mounted=
 the metal and positioned it properly, Vestige leaped
from his position, sp=
rang through the air, and with grim determination
landed squarly on the oth=
erside sending Tuscon sailing through the air
in the direction of the figur=
e on the bed, who had up to this time had
some how remained clear of all th=
e weapon's fire! No doubt that that
would soon change with Tuscon moving qu=
ickly in his direction.

As Tuscon moved through the air the insectoids att=
empted to follow
him, a spray of metal and energy following him in a focuse=
d swath of
destuctive power. Then with deadly precision the flying insectio=
ds
buzzed and then shot through the air quickly attemopting to close in
on =
the temporarily flying Autobot.
